title: Uninstall extension with policies.json
content:
I have an extension that has installation_mode set to force_installed at the policies.json file (at /Applications/Firefox.app/Contents/Resources/distribution/policies.json for macOs). I want to force the extension to remove from the browser (without any action from the end user). The extension id is 111 and by these templates: https://mozilla.github.io/policy-templates/#extensions, I tried to modify the policies.json to be: { 

 "policies": {    "Extensions": {      "Uninstall": ["111"]    }  }

} Doesn't seem to work (after this change, the extension can be removed, but only manually). What can I do? Same goes goes linux.

Thank you for you help!
creator: guy.m

title: Adatta ad area stampabile
content: Dopo l'ultimo aggiornamento non mi funziona più l'adatta ad area stampabile, io stampo su foglio A6 in formato scontrino, la stampa dopo l'aggiornamento mi esce tutta a sinistra e non al centro del foglio.

title: How to close existing Firefox process, to be able to connect to WEB
content:
I get message when trying to connect to the WEB via Firefox. "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. To use Firefox, you must first close the existing Firefox process, restart your device, or use a different profile".

How to close the running but not responding Firefox process ? To be able to connect to the web
creator: urban.forsberg1953

title: Unable to connect
content:
I am no longer able to connect to my website on Firefox on my iMac running Big Sur. I can see it on Safari and on my Macbook. I have cleared the cache. My server support suggested Cloudflare could be causing an issue and I have now had that removed. After allowing time for the adjusted DNS to propagate the issue remains.

Here is the message:

Unable to connect

An error occurred during a connection to amandacadabra.com. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Firefox is permitted to access the web.

I am not trying to access the URL using a bookmark. I am not using any extensions. All other sites are loading as normal and at normal speeds.

Any help would be appreciated. Thank you!
creator: suzanne22

title: Website garbaged on Firefox, displays OK on Edge browser
content: Firefox 64-bit 114.0.1 on Windows 11 with latest updates. When using Firefox, articles on The Guardian website are displaying with text overlaying images on the web page. The same problem does not happen if I view the same web page using the MS Edge browser on the same PC. This problem happens with every article I have viewed on The Guardian website, but I have not seen it on any web page on any other website. As an example, see the screen shots below of the same web page (https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2023/jun/14/charge-dropped-against-man-accused-of-killing-german-backpacker) viewed on Firefox and Edge.
creator: njhp94

title: OLG.ca access to my desktop location
content: Hello, I have made all the required changes to my privacy settings but still not able to Login to OLG.ca website via Firefox, I keep getting the following msg... Sorry! We can’t seem to access your location. We need to confirm you’re playing in Ontario. Please enable your location services..........Pls note, I am able to login via Microsoft Edge. Hope you can help me solve this problem.
creator: mcdogman1

title: Printing
content: I received a receipt from a store & when I open it up, all the pages show up. When I go to print it, a couple of the pages are blank. This just happened when AOLMail updated to a new version, but it works in Chrome & Edge. Any ideas on how to get this to work in Firefox? It worked before this last update.
